name: Greek Lemon-Oregano Chicken Thighs with Zucchini and Tzatziki
description: Pan-seared, oven-finished chicken thighs with lemon, oregano, and garlic, served over sautéed zucchini and topped with tzatziki and feta. Mild, keto-friendly flavors for a quick family dinner.
prep_steps: Pat dry the chicken thigh fillets with paper towels.
Zucchini: trim ends and slice into half-moons about 1 cm thick.
Zest and juice the lemon; cut remaining lemon into wedges.
cook_steps: Season chicken on both sides with salt, black pepper, half the oregano, half the minced garlic, and half the lemon zest.
Heat an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat with 1 tbsp olive oil. Sear chicken 3–4 minutes per side until golden.
Transfer skillet to the oven and cook 8–10 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Rest 3 minutes.
While chicken bakes, heat a large pan over medium heat with 1 tbsp olive oil. Add remaining garlic and sauté 30 seconds.
Add zucchini, remaining oregano, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Sauté 3–4 minutes until just tender; remove from heat and toss with remaining lemon zest and half the lemon juice.
Slice chicken if desired. Plate zucchini, top with chicken, spoon tzatziki over, and scatter feta and parsley.
Finish with a light sprinkle of sumac and a squeeze of lemon to taste.
